title: Request to ATF for communications with screenwriter Terry Rossio between 2004 and 2008

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications between the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) and Hollywood writer Terry Rossio (born July 2, 1960, in Kalamazoo, Michigan), between 2004 and 2008, which is the period shortly before, during, and shortly after the production of the film "Deja Vu," which Mr. Rossio co-wrote and which was made with the participation of the ATF based on a recent FOIA release to me. Such communications may include, but should not be limited to, emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to DoD for all communications with actor/director Jerry Bruckheimer over last 20 years

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the Hollywood producer and media executive Jerry Bruckheimer (born Jerome Leon Bruckheimer on September 21, 1943, in Detroit, Michigan), within the 20-year record retention schedule for such records (as specified on p. 202 of the May 2022 DoD document titled "Records Disposition Schedules," Record Group 303). Such communications may include, but should not be limited to, emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Army support for 2024 documentary "The Good Virus"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the US Army and the production of an upcoming documentary titled "The Good Virus."  Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Good Virus," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

Attached is a production assistance agreement signed between the Department of Defense and the production company of "The Good Virus." The agreement states that the US Army is to escort the production to Walter Reed Army Institute of Research to conduct an interview with Dr. Mikeljon Nikolich. I request all records relating to this visit specifically and, as requested above, more generally any records pertaining to Army collaboration with the production.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to DoD for all communications with producer and executive Mark Fasano over last 20 years

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to DoD for all communications with producer and executive Mark Fasano over last 20 years
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the Hollywood producer and media executive Mark Fasano, producer of movies such as "Land of Bad" (2024) and "American Ultra" (2015), within the 20-year record retention schedule for such records (as specified on p. 202 of the May 2022 DoD document titled "Records Disposition Schedules," Record Group 303). title: OSS Records of Dr Rudolph Katz

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OSS Records of Dr Rudolph Katz
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OSS Records pertaining to Dr Rudolph Katz, source of several references on Nazi Germany and its leaders produced by the OSS in 1942, as mentioned on multiple pages in CIA reading room document CIA-RDP82-00038R001000150010-5

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Mockridge
